modules.name: autoprefixer
modules.longDescription: Removes unnecessary prefixes based on the `browsers` option. In this mode **it will not add new prefixes** to the CSS file.

modules.name: core
modules.longDescription: Trims whitespace inside and around rules, selectors & declarations, plus removes the final semicolon inside every selector.

modules.name: filter-optimiser
modules.longDescription: Trims whitespace in filter functions, such as CSS filters and legacy Microsoft effects.

modules.name: function-optimiser
modules.longDescription: Trims whitespace in CSS functions, except for `filter`.

modules.name: postcss-calc
modules.longDescription: Reduces CSS `calc` expressions whereever possible, ensuring both browser compatibility and compression.

modules.name: postcss-colormin
modules.shortDescription: Converts color values to shorter equivalents
modules.longDescription: Converts between hex, hsl, rgb and CSS keywords, in order to produce the smallest equivalent color value.

modules.name: postcss-convert-values
modules.longDescription: Converts between equivalent length, time & angle values. Note that *by default*, length values are not converted.

modules.name: postcss-discard-comments
modules.longDescription: Removes comments in and around rules, selectors & declarations. Note that any special comments marked with `!` are kept by default.

modules.name: postcss-discard-duplicates
modules.longDescription: Removes duplicated rules, at-rules and declarations. Note that this only works for *exact* duplicates.

modules.name: postcss-discard-empty
modules.longDescription: Removes empty rules, media queries & rules with empty selectors, as they do not affect the output.

modules.name: postcss-discard-unused
modules.longDescription: Removes at-rules that do not have any bearing on the CSS file. This is unsafe if you have other stylesheets which pair up to these rules.

modules.name: postcss-filter-plugins
modules.longDescription: This helps increase performance of the module when used alongside other PostCSS plugins, by excluding duplicates. It does not actually transform the CSS.

modules.name: postcss-merge-idents
modules.shortDescription: Merges duplicated at-rules with different names
modules.longDescription: This will merge rules together that may have slightly different naming but do the same thing. Note that this is only unsafe if you rely on those animation names in JavaScript.

modules.name: postcss-merge-longhand
modules.longDescription: Collapses longhand properties into the shorthand representation, and where possible will also collapse top/right/bottom/left values. Supports `margin`, `padding` & `border` longhands.

modules.name: postcss-merge-rules
modules.longDescription: Merges adjacent rules by selectors & overlapping property/value pairs.

modules.name: postcss-minify-font-values
modules.longDescription: Normalizes font & font-family declarations, and can convert font weight keywords to numeric values.

modules.name: postcss-minify-gradients
modules.longDescription: Normalizes linear and radial gradient parameters.

modules.name: postcss-minify-params
modules.longDescription: Trims whitespace and normalizes at-rule parameters.

modules.name: postcss-minify-selectors
modules.longDescription: Removes unnecessary qualified universal selectors, unquotes attribute selectors, trims & normalizes selector strings.

modules.name: postcss-normalize-charset
modules.shortDescription: Ensures that a single @charset is defined
modules.longDescription: Ensures that only a single `@charset` is present in the CSS file, and moves it to the top of the document. This prevents multiple, invalid declarations occurring through naïve CSS concatenation.

modules.name: postcss-normalize-url
modules.longDescription: Normalizes URL strings. It can remove default ports, resolve unnecessary directory traversal & unquote the value.

modules.name: postcss-ordered-values
modules.longDescription: Properties affected by this transform can accept their arguments in an arbitrary order. This module normalizes that order, facilitating easier de-duplication.

modules.name: postcss-reduce-idents
modules.longDescription: Renames at-rules such as `@keyframes`. This can be potentially unsafe if other JS/CSS files need to read this definition.

modules.name: postcss-reduce-transforms
modules.longDescription: Converts between transform functions when there is a shorthand equivalent.

modules.name: postcss-svgo
modules.longDescription: Compresses inline SVG definitions with [SVGO](https://github.com/svg/svgo).

modules.name: postcss-unique-selectors
modules.longDescription: Naturally sorts selectors for every rule, and removes duplicates.

modules.name: postcss-zindex
modules.longDescription: Rebases z-index values. This is unsafe as it could potentially clash with other stylesheets, or JavaScript injected styles. However, it is safe if your stacking context has wholly been extracted into CSS.

modules.name: reduce-positions
modules.longDescription: Normalizes background position in the `background` shorthand and `background-position` properties.

modules.name: style-cache
modules.shortDescription: Normalizes whitespace from previous PostCSS plugins
modules.longDescription: When combining cssnano with other PostCSS plugins, this will normalize the whitespace created by generating rules.
